items.title: Drugmaker AstraZeneca profit jumps as US business grows
items.summary:
- AstraZeneca's Q3 net profit jumped *77%* to *$2.53 billion*, driven by strong oncology sales.
- Group revenue grew *12%* to *$15.2 billion*, with oncology powering growth and a push to expand its US manufacturing footprint.
- CEO Pascal Soriot said the US strategy is central, citing a historic deal to lower American drug prices and plans to invest about *$50 billion* in US manufacturing and R&D by 2030.

items.title: Cummins India logs 42% rise in Q2 net profit to ₹638 crore
items.summary:
- Cummins India Ltd reported a **42%** rise in Q2 net profit to **₹638 crore** for the quarter ended September 30. 
- Total sales rose **28%** to **₹3,122 crore**, with domestic sales at **₹2,577 crore** (+28% YoY, +10% sequential) and exports at **₹545 crore** (+24% YoY, +4% QoQ). 
- Management cited steady demand and **operational efficiency** as growth drivers, with a cautiously optimistic outlook for domestic and international markets.

items.title: US blocks Nvidia sale of scaled-down AI chips to China
items.summary:
- The *White House* blocked Nvidia from selling its scaled-down **B30A** AI chips to China, per *The Information*.
- Nvidia reportedly provided samples to Chinese customers, while Beijing's rules require only domestically developed chips for state-funded data centers.
- Nvidia says it has *zero share* in China's datacenter market and is pursuing design changes as export controls and regulatory headwinds persist.

items.title: Iron ore set for weekly loss amid soft steel demand
items.summary:
- *Iron ore futures* fell as *steel demand* in China weakened and production cuts weighed on prices.
- The most-traded January iron ore on the Dalian Exchange slid 1.16% to 766 yuan/ton, while the Singapore benchmark declined about 1.8% to $102.05/ton, for a weekly drop near 3.95%.
- *Analysts* say China’s steel overcapacity crackdown and soft demand across real estate and manufacturing point to a bearish near-term outlook into Q4.

items.title: AI-led productivity headroom in India
items.summary:
- In *India*, the headroom for *AI*-driven productivity is higher than in many nations, according to **S Krishnan**.
- Globally, about 70% use AI for entertainment, but in *India* it’s used more for business and enterprise purposes.
- The **Business Software Alliance** and partners have called for an India-wide agenda to adopt enterprise *AI*, including easing cross-border data transfers and access to non-sensitive government datasets.

items.title: Musk: Tesla mega AI chip fab, Intel talks
items.summary: - Musk says Tesla may have to build a *gigantic chip fab* to mass‑produce AI chips. - He floated **Intel** as a potential partner, but no deal has been signed yet. - AI5 will start with limited production in 2026 and AI6 could reach higher volume and ~2x performance by mid‑2028.

items.title: Akamai sees Q4 sales above estimates on AI demand
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- Akamai forecasts Q4 revenue of about $1.07–$1.09 billion, driven by strong *AI* demand and its *content delivery network* offerings.
- Shares rose nearly *6%* in after-hours trading as the company narrowed its full-year revenue range.
- Its *AI* and cloud infrastructure strength helped post a Q3 revenue beat and underscored Akamai's resilience as rivals like Netflix and Apple expand their own **CDN** networks.

Solar boom to create ₹3,700 crore recycling market by 2047
items.summary:
- **CEEW** estimates a **₹3,700 crore** recycling market by 2047 for India's solar sector.
- Recovered materials such as *silicon*, *copper*, *aluminium* and *silver* could meet about **38%** of demand and prevent about **37 million tonnes of CO2** by substituting recycled for virgin resources.
- By 2047, **11 million tonnes** of solar waste would require **~300 facilities** and **₹4,200 crore** in investments, with profitability hinging on lower module prices or policy tools like **EPR** and tax incentives.

items.title: Mankind Pharma posts fourth straight profit fall on tax cuts
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- Mankind Pharma posts a fourth straight quarterly profit fall as GST tax cuts hit sales and distributors delay OTC purchases.
- Net profit fell about 22% to 5.12 billion rupees; revenue rose 20.8% to 36.97 billion in the quarter ended Sept 30.
- Domestic market share rose 1.9% driven by anti-diabetic and cardiovascular drugs, while OTC sales were pressured; Torrent Pharma to report earnings on Nov 7.

items.title: Spacewood Furnishers raises ₹300cr from A91 Partners
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- Spacewood Furnishers raises *₹300 crore* from **A91 Partners**, signaling a strategic PE investment.
- Valued at about *₹1,200 crore*, the deal awards a significant minority stake to **A91 Partners** to fund expansion and brand-building.
- Plans to expand to 100 stores nationwide and boost omnichannel reach with Amazon and Pepperfry.

Solar waste crisis: 11 Mt by 2047 & recycling
items.summary:
- India will generate about *11 million tonnes* of solar waste by 2047, needing ~*300 recycling plants* and ₹4,200 crore in investment.
- Recovered materials such as *silicon*, *copper*, *aluminium* and *silver* could unlock a ₹3,700-crore market and cut carbon.
- Early-stage market needs policy steps like *EPR targets*, data sharing and a central solar inventory to spur a *circular economy*.

items.title: Concord Control Systems posts 85% profit jump in H1 FY26
items.summary:
- The company reported an 84.9% YoY jump in *PAT* for H1 FY26 to ₹16 crore, up from ₹8.67 crore.
- Total revenue rose 63% to ₹83 crore for six months ended 30 September 2025, with *EBITDA* at ₹21.7 crore and an EBITDA margin of 26.65% amid higher operating costs.
- Management expects continued order inflows and growth via *embedded electronic solutions*, aiming for long-term value creation through innovation and strong partnerships.

items.title: GSK India posts higher Q2 profit on specialty medicines
items.summary:
- India's GlaxoSmithKline Pharmaceuticals posted a *2% rise* in Q2 profit to **2.57 billion rupees**, driven by its *specialty medicines* portfolio.
- Revenue from operations declined **3%** to **9.8 billion rupees** as supply constraints and GST effects weighed on sales; Shingrix boosted earnings.
- A May plant fire disrupted Calpol supply; the stock tumbled in August as the company expanded into cancer care with two oncology drugs.

items.title: Biovac opens vaccine lab in Cape Town to boost Africa
items.summary: - **Biovac** opened a state-of-the-art product development lab in Cape Town, backed by the *Gates Foundation*, to accelerate vaccine development and manufacturing in **Africa**.\n- The facility enables end-to-end work from development to final formulation, including *mRNA* drug-substance development and nanoparticle formulation.\n- The project supports **Africa**'s goal for local vaccine production by 2040 and reduces dependence on imports.

items.title: Phillips Machine Tools unveils new expertise center in Chakan, Pune, to drive manufacturing innovation
Zydus Lifesciences Q2 net profit up 38% to ₹1,259 cr
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- **Net profit** rose **38%** YoY to **₹1,259 crore** for the quarter ended September 30, 2025.
- Revenue from operations climbed to **₹6,123 crore**, with robust sales growth in the US and India.
- The board approved raising up to **₹5,000 crore** via the issue of securities.

items.title: Defence Secretary Rajesh Kumar Singh explores production avenues in Israeli companies
items.summary:
- Defence Secretary Rajesh Kumar Singh visited Elbit Systems, Rafael Advanced Defense Systems, and Israel Aerospace Industries to explore avenues for *co-production* and *co-development*, reinforcing **Atmanirbhar Bharat**.
- An **MoU on Defence Cooperation** was signed to deepen bilateral collaboration, outlining areas such as strategic dialogues, defence industrial partnerships, and capability development, with a focus on **Science and Technology**, **AI**, and **Cyber Security**.
- The Joint Working Group review reaffirmed the long-standing defence partnership and discussed future collaboration to enhance capabilities and technological ties with Israel.

Axiscades & Electronic Bird Control to bring E-Raptor drones
items.summary:
- *E-Raptor* is being introduced in India through a MoU between **Axiscades** and *Electronic Bird Control*, aiming for local production under the **Make in India initiative** for defence and civilian use.
- The falcon-inspired drone blends *biomimetic engineering* with UAV tech to support surveillance, airport safety, wildlife management, and potential defence reconnaissance.
- This partnership signals a milestone in drone technology and international collaboration, with potential lasting implications for safety standards and strategic capabilities in India.

items.title: Hindalco shares tumble over 6% on fire-damage shock at Novelis plant
items.summary:
- *Hindalco Industries*' shares fell over 6% after *Novelis* flagged a fire at its Oswego hot‑mill that will dent free cash flow by about $500–$650 million and lift capex.
- The blaze was confined to the hot‑mill area; restoration is underway with restart by end‑December and a 4–6 week ramp‑up; 70–80% of damages are insured.
- *Novelis* posted a 27% YoY rise in net income to $163 million, with Bay Minette capex at $5 billion and ROI now seen in the high single digits.

Jyoti Global Plast charts a new flight path with indigenous industrial cleaning drones
Roshni to build Punjab's first giga-scale solar plant
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- *Roshni Renewable LLP* plans Punjab's first **giga-scale solar module plant** with an initial capacity of *1.8 GW*, a JV of Valco professionals and Solidus Techno Power.
- The project, built with *Jinchen*, reinforces **Make in India** and reduces reliance on imported solar components.
- It is expected to boost Punjab's industrial ecosystem, generate jobs, and support India's renewable energy transition in the long term.

items.title: Delhivery launches Freight Index One for Indian trucking
items.summary: - Freight Index One provides historical, current, and forward-looking *full truckload pricing* estimates to boost price transparency in India's trucking market.\n- The tool targets transporters, fleet owners, shippers, and 3PLs, drawing on nearly a decade of data and indicators such as *fuel prices*, *toll rates*, and *seasonality* to benchmark rates.\n- CTO Kapil Bharati says data will be shared with industry partners to improve price negotiations and budgeting as more participants feed back into the model.

items.title: Delhivery launches Freight Index One for trucking pricing
items.summary:
- *Delhivery launches Freight Index One* to provide historical, current, and forward-looking *full truckload pricing* estimates. 
- The platform aims to bring **transparency** across major lanes and will share data with shippers, brokers, and logistics partners to enable better budgeting and price benchmarking. 
- Industry officials say wider participation will improve index accuracy as market feedback feeds into the models.

items.title: Britannia appoints Rakshit Hargave as CEO & Exec Director
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary: - Britannia appoints *Rakshit Hargave* as **Executive Director** and **CEO** for a five-year term starting 15 December 2025, reporting to Varun Berry. - Hargave is a veteran of the consumer industry, joining from **Birla Opus** after leading Beiersdorf across ASEAN, ANZ, Africa and serving as MD of NIVEA India. - An IIT Varanasi alumnus with an Electrical Engineering degree and an MBA from **FMS Delhi**, he has been honoured with the Distinguished Young Alumni Award.

items.title: SAIL Bokaro makes first special electrical steel
items.summary:
- The Steel Authority of India Limited's Bokaro Plant produced about *1,100 tonnes* of *0.5 mm* IS 18316 *NGO electrical steel* for the first time, broadening its portfolio of value-added products.
- The *NGO electrical steel* is designed with *low carbon* for ductility and *high silicon* for magnetic efficiency, enabling use in electric motors, generators, transformers, and EV rotors for better energy efficiency.
- The achievement, via the *SMS-II route* with a tailored composition and rolling steps (*HSM* to *CRM-3*), demonstrates SAIL's capability in advanced steels for power, automotive, and renewable energy sectors.

items.title: Sun Pharma Q2 net profit up 3% at ₹3,118 cr
SAEL Industries to invest ₹22,000 crore in Andhra Pradesh
items.summary: - SAEL Industries plans to invest *₹22,000 crore* across *renewable energy*, *biomass*, *data centres*, and *port development* in *Andhra Pradesh*, with a potential to create *over 70,000 jobs*.\n- The investment is expected to be signed at the *CII Partnership Summit* in *Visakhapatnam* (Nov 14–15), and includes seven *solar/BESS* projects totaling *1,750 MW* in *Kadapa* and *Kurnool*.\n- The package also covers a *200 MW biomass project*, a *₹3,000 crore data centre*, and a *₹4,000 crore port project*, with the company already investing *₹3,200 crore* and commissioning *600 MW* in nine months.

items.title: Pavna Industries opens new R&D Centre in Noida
items.summary:
- **Pavna Industries** opened a new *R&D Centre* in *Noida* to bolster automotive innovation and product development. 
- The facility focuses on **electronic components**, **lock systems**, **switches**, and other advanced automotive solutions to meet evolving customer needs and international standards. 
- **Swapnil Jain**, Managing Director, says the centre will accelerate product development, improve efficiency, and strengthen India's position in **advanced automotive engineering** for **OEM** partners and end customers.

items.title: Schaeffler, Neura Robotics to develop humanoids
items.summary:
- Schaeffler and Neura Robotics will jointly develop and supply key components for *humanoids*. 
- Schaeffler plans to deploy a mid-four-digit number of *humanoids* in production by 2035 and expand into AI-driven robotics and related sectors. 
- CEO Klaus Rosenfeld said the move includes portfolio streamlining, including selling the turbocharger business in China, while pursuing AI‑driven humanoid opportunities.

items.title: Blue Star posts profit rise on strong commercial demand
items.summary:
- *2.9% rise in second-quarter profit* driven by strength in the *commercial air-conditioning* segment.
- *Net profit rose to 990 million rupees* and revenue climbed to *24.22 billion rupees*, up *6.4%*.
- *Commercial air-conditioning grew 16.5%* while *residential air-conditioning slid 9.5%* as GST cuts weighed on demand.

items.title: Honeywell Automation's quarterly profit rises on improved demand
items.summary: - Honeywell Automation India posted a 3.8% YoY rise in Q2 profit to 1.20 billion rupees, driven by improved *industrial activity* and execution of existing orders.\n- Revenue from operations rose 12.3% to 11.49 billion rupees, helped by stronger demand for *automation* and incentives for *clean energy*.\n- The broader Indian industrial upturn supported orders for Honeywell's *smart building systems* and other automation solutions.

items.title: Blue Star taps Manish Jha as Group President, Manufacturing
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *Manish Jha* appointed as Group President, *Manufacturing* at Blue Star, effective 5 November 2025.
- He is an engineering graduate from *NIT Patna* and MBA from *IIM Indore*, with an APICS certification in Production and Inventory Management.
- With ~26 years at *Tata Motors* and *Tata Cummins*, he will drive the company's manufacturing strategy to boost *efficiency* and *scalability*.

items.title: India invites Romanian firms to join manufacturing ecosystem
items.summary:
- India invites Romanian enterprises to join its dynamic manufacturing ecosystem under *Make in India* and *Production-Linked Incentive (PLI)* schemes.
- The Brașov Forum highlighted expanding bilateral investment across automotive, aerospace, defence, renewables, engineering services and ICT, with MoUs and matchmaking for joint ventures.
- The talks align with a broader India-EU framework, signaling progress toward an *India-EU Free Trade Agreement*, as exports to Romania surpassed *$1.03B* in FY2024-25 and bilateral trade stood at about *$2.98B* in FY2023-24.

items.title: Asia driving global manufacturing recovery, India among leaders
items.summary:
- Asia's manufacturing recovery gained momentum in October, led by *India*, *Thailand*, and *Vietnam* as export demand and orders rebound.
- *India* topped global manufacturing rankings with a *PMI* of 59.2 in October, driven by festive demand and *GST reforms*.
- *Asia ex-China and Japan* *PMI* rose to 52.7, a 14-month high, signaling sustained expansion despite global headwinds.

items.title: Majhi unveils ₹46k crore port and shipbuilding plan in Odisha
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- Odisha Chief Minister *Mohan Charan Majhi* announced over **₹46,000 crore** investment to create a new port at **Bahuda** in **Ganjam district** and a **shipbuilding and repair centre** at the **Mahanadi river mouth near Paradip**.
- The package includes **₹21,500 crore** for the Bahuda port and **₹24,700 crore** for the Paradip shipyard, plus a **world-class cruise terminal** at **Puri**.
- These projects are expected to boost trade, tourism and industry, aligning with **Sagarmala**, **Gati Shakti** and the **National Logistics Policy**.

items.title: Deepak Fertilisers Q2 profit up 1.5% on nutrition demand
items.summary:
- DFPCL reported a 1.5% year‑on‑year rise in consolidated net profit to ₹2.13 billion for the quarter ended 30 September 2025, supported by steady demand for its **crop-nutrition** products.
- Revenue from fertilisers and chemicals segments together accounted for more than half of total income, rising 16.2% and 1.5% year on year, with expenses up 10.9% due to higher materials costs.
- Above‑average monsoon rainfall boosted sowing and fertilizer demand in the June–September season, benefiting companies like **DFPCL** that supply both commodity and specialty fertilisers.

items.title: LG plans Make-in-India push for its electronics machinery
Astrophel's cryogenic pump debut at BRICS Summit
items.summary:
- Astrophel Aerospace showcased its indigenously engineered *cryogenic pump* at the **BRICS Innovation Summit** in Moscow.
- Co-founders Suyash Bafna and Immanuel Louis met potential investors to explore export opportunities across BRICS markets as the pump undergoes validation at *ISRO*.
- The project aims to certify dual-use cryogenic hardware for rocket engines and in oil & gas, medical tech, and energy, strengthening India’s export-ready **Make in India** supply chain.
